events.title: Napoleon Bonaparte Escapes from Elba
events.description: Napoleon Bonaparte escaped from the island of Elba and returned to France, beginning the Hundred Days before his final defeat at Waterloo.
events.significance: This event marked the temporary restoration of Napoleon's rule and led to the final phase of the Napoleonic Wars.

events.title: Zimmermann Telegram Intercepted
events.description: British intelligence intercepted the Zimmermann Telegram, in which Germany proposed a military alliance with Mexico against the United States during World War I.
events.significance: The revelation of the telegram helped galvanize US public opinion and contributed to the United States entering World War I.

events.title: First Public Demonstration of Radar by Robert Watson-Watt
events.description: Scottish engineer Robert Watson-Watt publicly demonstrated radar technology, paving the way for its use in detecting enemy aircraft during WWII.
events.significance: Radar became a crucial technology in warfare and civilian applications, transforming military defense strategies.

events.title: The World Trade Center Bombing
events.description: A truck bomb exploded beneath the North Tower of the World Trade Center in New York City, killing six people and injuring over a thousand.
events.significance: This attack was one of the first major terrorist attacks on US soil, leading to increased security measures and eventually influencing counterterrorism policies.
